content:
Using Google Calendar is a fantastic way to stay organized and access your schedule from anywhere.

Let's add those upcoming events to your Google Calendar:

**Step 1: Create a new calendar**

If you haven't already, create a new Google Calendar specifically for your music events. You can do this by:

* Going to calendar.google.com
* Clicking on the "+" icon next to "Other calendars"
* Selecting "New calendar"
* Naming it something like "Concerts" or "Music Events"
* Clicking "Create"

**Step 2: Add the COIN event**

* Open your "Concerts" calendar
* Click on the date April 15th
* Click on the "Create" button
* Enter the event details:
	+ Title: COIN
	+ Location: [Venue name], DC (you can add the exact venue name if you know it)
	+ Time: [Time of the event]
	+ Description: Add any notes you want to remember, like "Tickets purchased on [date]" or "Meeting friends at [time]"
	+ Reminders: Set a reminder for the day before or a few hours before the event to ensure you don't forget
* Click "Save"

**Step 3: Add the Lucy Dacus event**

Repeat the same steps as above, but for the Lucy Dacus event:

* Click on the date May 1st
* Click on the "Create" button
* Enter the event details:
	+ Title: Lucy Dacus
	+ Location: Union Transfer, Philly
	+ Time: [Time of the event]
	+ Description: Add any notes you want to remember, like "Considering meeting friends at [time]" or "Need to buy tickets by [date]"
	+ Reminders: Set a reminder for the day before or a few hours before the event to ensure you don't forget
* Click "Save"

Now you should have both events added to your "Concerts" calendar! You can easily access and edit them from any device with an internet connection.

**Tips:**

* Make sure to set reminders for the events so you don't forget.
* You can also add a link to the event ticket or a website with more information about the concert.
* If you have friends attending the same event, you can invite them to the calendar event and share the details.
* Consider adding a hashtag or label to the event title, like "#indieRock" or "#concertSeason", to help you quickly filter and search for specific types of events.

How's that? Do you have any other upcoming events you'd like to add to your calendar?
